CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineWidth

The CanvasRenderingContext2D.lineWidth property of the Canvas 2D API sets the thickness of lines in coordinate space units.

See also the chapter Applying styles and color in the Canvas Tutorial.

Syntax

ctx.lineWidth = value;

Options

value
A number specifying the line width in coordinate space units. Zero, negative, Infinity, and NaN values are ignored. This value is 1.0 by default.

Examples

Using the lineWidth property

This is just a simple code snippet using the lineWidth property to draw lines with a rounded end.

HTML

<canvas id="canvas"></canvas>

JavaScript

var canvas = document.getElementById('canvas');
var ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(20, 20);
ctx.lineWidth = 15;
ctx.lineTo(100, 100);
ctx.stroke();

WebKit/Blink-specific notes

  • In WebKit- and Blink-based Browsers, a non-standard and deprecated method ctx.setLineWidth() is implemented in addition to this property.

Gecko-specific notes

  • Starting Gecko 2.0 (Firefox 4 / Thunderbird 3.3 / SeaMonkey 2.1), setting lineWidth to a negative value no longer throws an exception; instead, it properly ignores non-positive values.
